meanings.definition: A projecting part of a fortification built at an angle to the line of a wall, so as to allow defensive fire in several directions.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers defended the castle from the bastion, shooting arrows at the enemy.
meanings.sent2: The ancient fortress had a strong bastion that protected it from attacks.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel thought the bastion was a giant tree branch to climb.
meanings.sent4: Her unwavering faith was a bastion against the storms of life.
meanings.sent5: The towering bastion stood tall, a symbol of strength and protection.

meanings.sent1: The old castle served as a bastion against invaders in the past.
meanings.sent2: The fort was a secure bastion, keeping the town safe from harm.
meanings.sent3: The children imagined the treehouse as their secret bastion against imaginary foes.
meanings.sent4: In her heart, the memories of her childhood home were a bastion of comfort.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse stood as a bastion of hope for sailors lost at sea.

meanings.definition: A place or system in which something (such as an old-fashioned idea) continues to survive.
meanings.sent1: The small bookstore was a bastion of traditional literature in the digital age.
meanings.sent2: The remote village remained a bastion of ancient customs and beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The quirky antique shop was a bastion of oddities and curiosities.
meanings.sent4: His vintage record collection was a bastion of classic music in a modern world.
meanings.sent5: The historic theater stood as a bastion of the arts in the bustling city.
